intro: Linosyris thunbergiana, commonly known as the Thunberg's linseed plant, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, producing small, round pods that contain several seeds. This species is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
